intro: Racosperma errabundum, commonly known as the variable acacia, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is known for its variability in growth form and leaf structure, which can differ depending on environmental conditions. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various wildlife species. Racosperma errabundum is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid regions.
